children.subject: Very likely (-: We're planning on continuing this DeCal for every future semester!
How likely is this class to be offered in the fall 22' or Spring 23'?

There are a lot of differences between this DeCal and CS 169. While both classes teach software engineering, they differ drastically in their approach and content. 

This DeCal covers HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, Node, Express, MongoDB, Figma, and AWS + some other random technologies.

On the other hand, CS 169 mostly uses Rails and Ruby, which I consider outdated in the industry, especially when compared to the technologies we teach in this DeCal. 

In terms of approach, CS 169 tends to dive much deeper into auxiliary topics such as project management and testing, while this DeCal prefers to spend its time diving deeper into the technologies we teach as well as focusing more on developing multiple projects and building cool SaaS products. There is a little bit of overlap between the two, but that only comes out to about ~ 2 weeks worth of content out of the 12 weeks of the course.

Can I understand this as both are built on the same foundation of full-stack development, but while 169 has a comprehensive introduction of the classical concept and some old-fashion technology, the Decal targets deeply at how to efficiently use the current development technologies and emphasizes the applicability?
Yup, that's correct! Couldn't have put it better myself.
May I ask what's the difference between this decal and cs169? Are there any overlap or totally different?

Before this semester, Cubstart focused more on flask, firebase, and other technologies, so there wasn’t a huge overlap between the two. There were some similar base topics, but overall they taught different technologies. They revamped their curriculum this semester, however, and now their content is very similar to ours. I can’t speak to Cubstart, but we’ve been teaching this curriculum for 4 semesters (2 as an internal education program, 2 as a DeCal now), so our material is very fleshed out and tested, whereas this is Cubstart’s first semester teaching this content.

We've also expanded to a greater degree than Cubstart has in the last year - Cubstart has 75 seats open in the academic guide, whereas we plan on taking 110-120 students total. This is also an assumption, but given that we have 2 lectures per week vs their lab and lecture every week, we may cover more material. Without seeing their lesson plans, however (ours our public, but there’s haven’t been released on their site yet), I cannot say anything for sure. We do plan to talk to them, however, to see if there's any way to collaborate for the good of the Berkeley community! Overall, however, Cubstart is still a great opportunity, and any initiative to teach the joys of development is a great one in my eyes.
How is this different from the Cubstart web dev decal?
The course is 3 units and covers a lot of material and has a good amount of assignments, so I'd say expect to put it 6-8 hours per week as you would any other 3 unit class.
How hefty is the workload of this class?

Unfortunately, there is no boost for previous applicants. We are expanding the number of people we take to 100 this semester, however, and plan to expand even further in future semesters, so the probability of receiving admission into the DeCal will increase proportionally.
I applied last semester but didn't get in. Will there be any "boost" for applicants who've shown interest in the past but were unable to be admitted?
The course number is CS 198, so it is an upper-division class. Unfortunately, however, CS DeCal courses do not count towards L&S CS or EECS graduation requirements.
Does this class count as an upper division class?

Lectures are recorded and posted to the Web Development at Berkeley youtube channel, which is linked on the DeCal website! Please do note, however, in order to be accepted into the DeCal and receive a passing grade you must attend most of the lectures. All the materials are public though so feel free to follow along at your own pace!
Will lectures be recorded? I can only make it to one of the days.
Also, when will we know if we get into it successfully?

Unfortunately, we cannot say our application numbers, but last semester's admission was very competitive. We're actively trying to expand so that we can take all students who are interested at some point in the future, but until then we'll require an application process.

For admission notifications, those will be sent out on January 31st, a day after the application deadline of January 30th.
How likely can I get into this course?
They're being sent out sometime today!
Just wondering when will the decision be out?
Unfortunately No - feel free to apply earlier in the semester next semester, or follow along this semester through fullstackdecal.com!
Are there still any open spot / possibility to enroll?

history.content:
If you're interested in learning the skills needed to tackle the technology side of efforts like starting a new business, breaking into the tech industry, and creating cool products that live on the internet, check out the Intro to Full-Stack Development Decal! This extremely popular DeCal is now in it's second semester, and going stronger than ever. In this course, you'll gain familiarity and practice using industry-standard development and design technologies such as JavaScript, React.js, Node.js, Figma, MongoDB, Express, AWS, HTML/CSS, and much more. You can find all course information at fullstackdecal.com.

No prior CS experience is needed! We encourage applications from students of all majors, years, and backgrounds, and aim to create a diverse classroom environment that's useful for all learners. Through a series of lecture-style lessons, homework, and projects, you'll soon be equipped to create any SaaS product you could dream of, not to mention the cool and advanced projects you'll be able to talk about and show to the world!

If you are interested, please fill out the interest form to stay updated on infosessions and deadlines. You can also find the application here:

  • interest form: https://forms.gle/K1iAuhezGSMTUfKb7
  • infosession 1 event: https://www.facebook.com/events/348063700170538/
  • infosession 2 event: https://www.facebook.com/events/224636553192406/
  • application form: https://forms.gle/uw6P28m7eicTeDm47

Applications are due January 30th at 11:59PM pacific time, and we'll have infosessions about the DeCal on January 24th and January 26th. We look forward to seeing you all there!

Go bears!
